channel.title: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?
channel.description:
I'll keep it short and sweet, I need a low voc paint that's preferably legal in the uk, that I can use with a spray gun(for an air compressor), and can be used to spray a motorcycle(mostly plastic fairings, metal tank). I'll be painting it white which provides an additional problem since I also need a gas/petrol resistant lacquer preferably or a clear top coat that won't turn the white paint yellow and follows the same guidelines.
I need low voc paint since I will be doing it as an amateur in my garden, that is, I won't have much in the way of safety gear other than eye protection, basic face mask and perhaps coveralls, so 2k and cellulose paint is absolutely out of the question.

try silk road.

but seriously its quite dangerous. just go to a local garage and ask them where would be best, they will give you some good advice.

item.title: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

haha oh so do i, but the guy who does the bodywork at my dads place is a nutter, and he wont spray 2pack without the booth & mask, so i figure if he wont do it it musnt be a joke

Read full topic
item.source: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?

item.title: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Even if you are doing it outside? Seems like you could just turn your head around, take a deep breath of air, and hold it while you spray the tank of the motorcycle.

But honestly, I don’t know anything about painting cars. I painted my tractor hood with a spray paint can, but I leave the important stuff to the professionals.

Read full topic
item.source: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?

item.title: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Most likely, no matter how toxic the stuff is, it won’t hurt or kill you just spraying a motorcycle outside once.

you’d be surprised, he wouldnt be the first person to underestimate 2pack and wake up in a hospital with lung damage

a pressurised mask isnt a luxury for isocyanates, its a requirement. (niall seems to already know this but)

Read full topic
item.source: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?

item.title: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:10, topic:441476”][quote author=TabbyKiller link=topic=544172.msg3990174#msg3990174 date=1336468332]
Black market?
[/quote]

Generally looking for something legal so I don’t accidentally kill myself while trying to spray it. As I mentioned on MSCP, 2k or 2 part paint generally requires a full air fed respirator because it can kill you or at the very least leave you with significant lifetime health problems.[/quote]

Most likely, no matter how toxic the stuff is, it won’t hurt or kill you just spraying a motorcycle outside once.

Read full topic
item.source: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?

item.title: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest

@moparisthebest wrote:

It can be pretty volatile stuff, so maybe they don’t allow you to ship it. Drive over to a store.

item.source: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?

item.title: Where the hell do I buy spray gun paint in the uk?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Here there are car paint shops you can get whatever you need at, or some local auto parts stores carry car paint too. Any type of enamel should be fine for that and easy to spray.

I was actually hoping to be able to order everything online but it seems I’m going to have to go to a paint shop to see if I can buy the paint.

Read full topic
